revised_title: The Photographic Action of Beta-Rays: Intensity and Velocity Dependence
tldr: This article investigates the photographic action of beta-rays and how it depends on the intensity and velocity of the particles. The authors study the relationship between blackening on exposure and the time of exposure, and they find that the response of the photographic plate is the same for beta-rays of all velocities. They also confirm that the Reciprocity Law holds for homogeneous particles.
